detail.content: Productions: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Graduate Acting Program Welcome from Mark Wing-Davey Applying Productions Training News Students Alumni  home > Graduate Acting > Productions         Productions      The Graduate Acting Program produces nearly 20 projects and full productions every season, drawn from a wide array of classics (Shakespeare, Chekhov, Shaw) to modern American landmarks (Odets, Williams, Kushner) to brand-new plays commissioned for our students by the up-and-coming professional playwrights.    One of the best ways to understand our training is to see our shows. Our current season and our past achievements can be found below:  Upcoming Productions Current Season Year 2 Projects Past Seasons   Industry Reservations for Actors Showcase 2015  Graduate Acting Program 721 Broadway, 5th Floor New York, NY 10003               Phone:       212 998 1960 Email Graduate Acting              Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Academic Services Student Life Financial Aid and Scholarships Career Development Counseling Services International Students Incoming Students Graduation Forms What is Special Programs? Production Center: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Production Center  NYU boasts one of the largest filmmaking facilities on the Eastern Seaboard, serving the needs of both our Undergraduate and Graduate film and video students. The facility is run by 11 full-time staff members and over 50 technical assistants that are both technically and professionally trained in many technical and aesthetic aspects of film production, including: film planning and production, equipment operation, equipment maintenance and repair.    The Production Center supports every aspect of the well-over 4,500 student projects shot every year, with technical seminars, industry-professional equipment, film stock and supplies, equipment repair services, and additional support for planning and development of student films. The equipment packages vary by level of study (fundamental through advanced/thesis), and are available to students enrolled in production courses. the production center consists of 5 areas which include the Advanced and Fundamental Equipment Areas, Repair Shop, Equipment Reservations Office, and the Production Office, which provides the students with the supplies and resources needed to produce a film or video.  Production Coordinator Eric Juhola 721 Broadway 9th floor New York, NY 10003 Phone: (212) 998-1790           Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Academic Services Student Life Financial Aid and Scholarships Career Development Counseling Services International Students Incoming Students Graduation Forms What is Special Programs? Production 2014-2015 Season: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        New Design for Stage & Film Welcome From Susan Hilferty About the Program Course Offerings Productions Student/Alumni Gallery News & Events Admin & Faculty  home > Design for Stage & Film > Production        Production 2014-2015 Season  The Department of Design has strong relationships with Tisch's acclaimed Graduate Acting Program as well as with the innovative Department of Dance. Additionally, opportunities to design productions in the Department of Undergraduate Drama, along with increased involvement with the renowned Graduate Film Program, widen the scope of production experience for design students. Each year, design students work collaboratively and creatively on over 35 plays, films, and dance concerts within the Tisch School of the Arts.    Production is viewed as running in tandem with design classes. All productions are directed by professional directors, including such notable names as Barry Edelstein, Michael Mayer, Bart Sher, Beverly Smith-Dawson, Marcus Stern, Liz Swados, Doug Wager, Mark Wing-Davey, Robert Woodruff, and Liviu Ciulei, many of whom continue working relationships with Tisch design students after they graduate.    2014-2015 Season  The Motherfucker with the Hat -
